clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Emotional Disorders During Treatment by Interferon Beta in Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Emotional Disorders During Treatment by Interferon Beta in Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study is planned to evaluate emotional disorders during treatment by interferon (IFN) beta in relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) subjects. This is an open-label exploratory study with no change of therapeutic behavior but with standardized neuropsychologic follow-up.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is planned to evaluate emotional disorders during treatment by IFN beta in RRMS subjects. This is an open-label, prospective, interventional, multicentric study with no change of therapeutic behavior but with standardized neuropsychologic follow-up. Subjects will undergo 13 evaluations (categorical and dimensional evaluations), 3 evaluations will be performed before the treatment (Baseline, Day 7 and 15) and 10 evaluations after the treatment (Month 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Emotional Dyscontrol Sub-score of the Depressive Mood Scale (Echelle d'Humeur Depressive [EHD]) Scale at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional dyscontrol sub-score is the sum of items 1, 2, 4, 5, 9, 10, and 11. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 28 (very much), where 28 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Emotional Dyscontrol Sub-score of the EHD Scale at Month 18
primary_outcome.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional dyscontrol sub-score is the sum of items 1, 2, 4, 5, 9, 10, and 11. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 28 (very much), where 28 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Emotional Dyscontrol Sub-score of the EHD Scale at Month 24
primary_outcome.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional dyscontrol sub-score is the sum of items 1, 2, 4, 5, 9, 10, and 11. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 28 (very much), where 28 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Emotional Abrasion Sub-score of the EHD Scale at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional abrasion sub-score is the sum of items 3, 6, 7, and 8. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 16 (very much), where 16 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in State-trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI State) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: STAI state scale is an auto-evaluation scale for anxiety. This scale includes 20 items that allow quantifying feeling of apprehension, tension, nervousness and worry that the participant feels at the time of the completion of the questionnaire. The 20 items are graded from 1 (no) to 4 (yes), where 'yes' corresponds to the best state for items 1, 2, 5, 8, 10, 11, 15, 16, 19, 20 (scoring was reversed before calculation of total score); and to the worst state for items 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 18. The total score ranged from 1 (best state) to 80 (worst state). (Spielberger CD et al., 1983)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: CES-D is an auto-questionnaire including 20 items to screen for depressive feelings and behaviour. The 20 items of this scale are graded from 0 (never) to 3 (always), where 3 corresponds to the most severe state with the exception of items 4, 8, 12 and 16 (scoring was reversed before the calculation of the total score). Total score ranged from 0 (never) to 60 (always), where 60 corresponds to most severe state. (Radloff LS, 1977)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Center for State-trait Anger Expression Inventory 2 (STAXI-state) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: STAXI-state scale measures the intensity of anger as an emotional state (state anger) and the disposition to experience angry feelings as a personality trait (trait anger). In this study only 1 of the original 6 scales was used, the state anger scale, which measures the intensity of anger at a given moment as emotional state. This scale consists of 15 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The total score range from 1 (not at all) to 60 (very much), where 60 corresponds to the worst state. (Spielberger CD, 1996)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue scale was derived from the United Kingdom Neurological Disability Scale (UKNDS), and evaluates fatigue according to the participant's subjective impression and the functional disability that it causes. 'Yes' or 'No' answers result in a score that ranges from 0 to 5, where a score 5 shows worse state. (Sharrack B et al., 1999)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects aged ≥ 18 years
- Subjects with RRMS
- Subjects with at least 2 relapses in the past two years (with last relapse finished or finishing)
- Subjects with indication of IFN beta treatment determined by the investigator
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (MS) without relapse
- Subjects with ongoing acute relapse
- Subjects already being treated with interferon
- Subjects with corticoid therapy for less than 15 days
- Subjects presenting acute major depression or treated with anti-depressant therapy
- Subjects involved in another therapeutic study
- Subjects with any condition which could interfere with a good compliance of this study
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply

overall_official.affiliation: Hôpital PELLEGRIN, Place Amélie Raba Léon 33076 BORDEAUX Cedex

reference.citation: Radat F, Lafittau M, Ouallet JC, Brochet B, Jouvent R. [Validation of EHD self questionnaire in multiple sclerosis]. Encephale. 2007 Jan-Feb;33(1):49-57. French.
Sharrack B, Hughes RA. The Guy's Neurological Disability Scale (GNDS): a new disability measure for multiple sclerosis. Mult Scler. 1999 Aug;5(4):223-33.
Spielberger, C. D., Gorsuch, R. L., Lushene, R., Vagg, P. R., & Jacobs, G. A. (1983). Manual for the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory. Palo Alto, CA: Consulting Psychologists Press
Radloff LS. The CES-D scale: A self-report depression scale for research in the general population. Applied Psychological Measurement. 1977;1:385-401.
Spielberger CD. Manual for the State-Anger Expression Inventory. Odessa, FL: Psychological Assessment Resources; 1996

group.title: Interferon-beta
group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

group.title: Interferon-beta
group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Out of a total of 79 participants, data for baseline measure (age) was available for 70 participants with at least one interferon-beta intake and with at least one evaluation of the primary criterion.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Out of a total of 79 participants, data for baseline measure (gender) was available for 70 participants with at least one interferon-beta intake and with at least one evaluation of the primary criterion.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Emotional Dyscontrol Sub-score of the Depressive Mood Scale (Echelle d'Humeur Depressive [EHD]) Scale at Month 12
outcome.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional dyscontrol sub-score is the sum of items 1, 2, 4, 5, 9, 10, and 11. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 28 (very much), where 28 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time-point.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Emotional Abrasion Sub-score of the EHD Scale at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
measure.description: EHD scale is a tool to assess the depressive mood dimensions 'lack of emotional control' (emotional dyscontrol) and 'blunted effect' which comprises of 11 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The emotional abrasion sub-score is the sum of items 3, 6, 7, and 8. The total possible score range from 1 (not at all) to 16 (very much), where 16 corresponds to worst state. (Radat F et al., 2007)
measure.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. outcome.title: Change From Baseline in State-trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI State) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
outcome.description: STAI state scale is an auto-evaluation scale for anxiety. This scale includes 20 items that allow quantifying feeling of apprehension, tension, nervousness and worry that the participant feels at the time of the completion of the questionnaire. The 20 items are graded from 1 (no) to 4 (yes), where 'yes' corresponds to the best state for items 1, 2, 5, 8, 10, 11, 15, 16, 19, 20 (scoring was reversed before calculation of total score); and to the worst state for items 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 18. The total score ranged from 1 (best state) to 80 (worst state). (Spielberger CD et al., 1983)
outcome.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in State-trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI State) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
measure.description: STAI state scale is an auto-evaluation scale for anxiety. This scale includes 20 items that allow quantifying feeling of apprehension, tension, nervousness and worry that the participant feels at the time of the completion of the questionnaire. The 20 items are graded from 1 (no) to 4 (yes), where 'yes' corresponds to the best state for items 1, 2, 5, 8, 10, 11, 15, 16, 19, 20 (scoring was reversed before calculation of total score); and to the worst state for items 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 18. The total score ranged from 1 (best state) to 80 (worst state). (Spielberger CD et al., 1983)
measure.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
outcome.description: CES-D is an auto-questionnaire including 20 items to screen for depressive feelings and behaviour. The 20 items of this scale are graded from 0 (never) to 3 (always), where 3 corresponds to the most severe state with the exception of items 4, 8, 12 and 16 (scoring was reversed before the calculation of the total score). Total score ranged from 0 (never) to 60 (always), where 60 corresponds to most severe state. (Radloff LS, 1977)
outcome.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
measure.description: CES-D is an auto-questionnaire including 20 items to screen for depressive feelings and behaviour. The 20 items of this scale are graded from 0 (never) to 3 (always), where 3 corresponds to the most severe state with the exception of items 4, 8, 12 and 16 (scoring was reversed before the calculation of the total score). Total score ranged from 0 (never) to 60 (always), where 60 corresponds to most severe state. (Radloff LS, 1977)
measure.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Center for State-trait Anger Expression Inventory 2 (STAXI-state) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
outcome.description: STAXI-state scale measures the intensity of anger as an emotional state (state anger) and the disposition to experience angry feelings as a personality trait (trait anger). In this study only 1 of the original 6 scales was used, the state anger scale, which measures the intensity of anger at a given moment as emotional state. This scale consists of 15 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The total score range from 1 (not at all) to 60 (very much), where 60 corresponds to the worst state. (Spielberger CD, 1996)
outcome.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

group.title: Interferon-beta
group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Center for State-trait Anger Expression Inventory 2 (STAXI-state) Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 18 and 24
measure.description: STAXI-state scale measures the intensity of anger as an emotional state (state anger) and the disposition to experience angry feelings as a personality trait (trait anger). In this study only 1 of the original 6 scales was used, the state anger scale, which measures the intensity of anger at a given moment as emotional state. This scale consists of 15 items graded in 4 degrees from 1 (not at all) to 4 (very much), where 4 corresponds to the worst state. The total score range from 1 (not at all) to 60 (very much), where 60 corresponds to the worst state. (Spielberger CD, 1996)
measure.population: ITT population: all participants with at least 1 interferon-beta intake and 1 evaluation of primary criterion, that is, at least 1 evaluation before treatment initiation and after Day 0 for emotional dyscontrol sub-score. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 and 24
outcome.description: Fatigue scale was derived from the United Kingdom Neurological Disability Scale (UKNDS), and evaluates fatigue according to the participant's subjective impression and the functional disability that it causes. 'Yes' or 'No' answers result in a score that ranges from 0 to 5, where a score 5 shows worse state. (Sharrack B et al., 1999)
outcome.population: ITT population. 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

group.title: Interferon-beta
group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Score at Months 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 and 24
measure.description: Fatigue scale was derived from the United Kingdom Neurological Disability Scale (UKNDS), and evaluates fatigue according to the participant's subjective impression and the functional disability that it causes. 'Yes' or 'No' answers result in a score that ranges from 0 to 5, where a score 5 shows worse state. (Sharrack B et al., 1999)
measure.population: ITT population. 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure. 'n' signifies those participants who were evaluated for this measure at that time point.

reported_events.desc: An adverse event (AE) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in the form of signs, symptoms, abnormal laboratory findings, or diseases that emerges or worsens relative to baseline during a clinical study with an Investigational Medicinal Product (IMP), regardless of causal relationship and even if no IMP has been administered.

group.title: Interferon-beta
group.description: Participants received interferon-beta based on investigator's discretion as per the clinical practice for 2 years.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.

point_of_contact.organization: Merck Serono, a division of Merck KGaA
